S4.T1.caption: Table 1: Comparison on the highest test accuracy for the four algorithm in the case of β=0.5𝛽0.5\beta=0.5
S4.T1.table:
\hhlineMethod SVHN CIFAR-10 CIFAR-100
FedGG 80.0%±0.2%plus-or-minuspercent80.0percent0.2\bm{80.0\%}\pm 0.2\% 71.1%±0.2%plus-or-minuspercent71.1percent0.2\bm{71.1\%}\pm 0.2\% 61.6%±0.1%plus-or-minuspercent61.6percent0.1\bm{61.6\%}\pm 0.1\%
FedAvg 79.6%±0.3%plus-or-minuspercent79.6percent0.379.6\%\pm 0.3\% 69.2%±0.4%plus-or-minuspercent69.2percent0.469.2\%\pm 0.4\% 60.1%±0.2%plus-or-minuspercent60.1percent0.260.1\%\pm 0.2\%
Fedprox 79.7%±0.4%plus-or-minuspercent79.7percent0.479.7\%\pm 0.4\% 69.0%±0.4%plus-or-minuspercent69.0percent0.469.0\%\pm 0.4\% 59.8%±0.2%plus-or-minuspercent59.8percent0.259.8\%\pm 0.2\%
Scaffold 78.2%±0.3%plus-or-minuspercent78.2percent0.378.2\%\pm 0.3\% 70.1%±0.3%plus-or-minuspercent70.1percent0.370.1\%\pm 0.3\% 61.0%±0.1%plus-or-minuspercent61.0percent0.161.0\%\pm 0.1\%
references: We evaluate the performance of the four algorithms on the three datasets with β=0.5𝛽0.5\beta=0.5 and β=0.1𝛽0.1\beta=0.1 and each algorithm is repeated by three times. For FedGG, we let the hyperparameters μ={001,0.01,0.1,1}𝜇0010.010.11\mu=\left\{001,0.01,0.1,1\right\} and show that it achieves the best performance in all three data sets with μ=0.01𝜇0.01\mu=0.01. For FedProx, we set its hyperparameter to be 0.01, which is the best hyperparameter mentioned in Ref. [15]. The highest tset accuracies of these algorithms over 100 communication rounds are given in Table 1 and Table 2.

From the results in Table 1 and Table 2, it can be concluded that FedGG achieves the highest test accuracy in all three data sets for both β=0.5𝛽0.5\beta=0.5 and β=0.1𝛽0.1\beta=0.1. Especially, in the extremely unbalanced case β=0.1𝛽0.1\beta=0.1; i.e., the data distribution is closer to a practical situation, FedGG has a better performance, which is respectively 0.5%percent0.50.5\%, 2.2%percent2.22.2\% and 2.9%percent2.92.9\% higher than the second highest test accuracy in the three data sets. Furthermore, we notice that the performance of the same algorithm on the same data set degrades in the case of β=0.1𝛽0.1\beta=0.1 compared to β=0.5𝛽0.5\beta=0.5, since the model divergence is more critical between clients. By introducing the model-cosine loss, the local model update is guided by the direction of global model update, which alleviates this problem.

references: We evaluate the performance of the four algorithms on the three datasets with β=0.5𝛽0.5\beta=0.5 and β=0.1𝛽0.1\beta=0.1 and each algorithm is repeated by three times. For FedGG, we let the hyperparameters μ={001,0.01,0.1,1}𝜇0010.010.11\mu=\left\{001,0.01,0.1,1\right\} and show that it achieves the best performance in all three data sets with μ=0.01𝜇0.01\mu=0.01. For FedProx, we set its hyperparameter to be 0.01, which is the best hyperparameter mentioned in Ref. [15]. The highest tset accuracies of these algorithms over 100 communication rounds are given in Table 1 and Table 2.

From the results in Table 1 and Table 2, it can be concluded that FedGG achieves the highest test accuracy in all three data sets for both β=0.5𝛽0.5\beta=0.5 and β=0.1𝛽0.1\beta=0.1. Especially, in the extremely unbalanced case β=0.1𝛽0.1\beta=0.1; i.e., the data distribution is closer to a practical situation, FedGG has a better performance, which is respectively 0.5%percent0.50.5\%, 2.2%percent2.22.2\% and 2.9%percent2.92.9\% higher than the second highest test accuracy in the three data sets. Furthermore, we notice that the performance of the same algorithm on the same data set degrades in the case of β=0.1𝛽0.1\beta=0.1 compared to β=0.5𝛽0.5\beta=0.5, since the model divergence is more critical between clients. By introducing the model-cosine loss, the local model update is guided by the direction of global model update, which alleviates this problem.

S4.T3.caption: Table 3: Comparison on communication rounds for the four algorithms to achieve the accuracy of FedAvg at Round 100 in the case of β=0.5𝛽0.5\beta=0.5
S4.T3.table:
\hhlineMethod SVHN CIFAR-10 CIFAR-100
rounds speedup rounds speedup rounds speedup
FedAvg 100 1×\times 100 1×\times 100 1×\times
Fedprox 88 1.13×\times 80 1.25×\times <1×\times
Scaffold <1×\times 59 1.69×\times 89 1.12×\times
FedGG 𝟔𝟓65\bm{65} 1.53×\bm{1.53}\times 𝟒𝟕47\bm{47} 2.12×\bm{2.12}\times 𝟕𝟎70\bm{70} 1.42×\bm{1.42}\times
references: In order to show the high communication efficiency of FedGG, we take the algorithm test accuracy of FedAvg at the 100t​hsuperscript100𝑡ℎ100^{th} communication round as a benchmark, and list the communication rounds required for the other algorithms to achieve this accuracy in Table 3 and Table 4 with β=0.5𝛽0.5\beta=0.5 and β=0.1𝛽0.1\beta=0.1, respectively. We can observe that compared to the other algorithms, FedGG has a significant decrease in the number of communication rounds, especially on the CIFAR-10 dataset with β=0.1𝛽0.1\beta=0.1. The speedup reaches 2.63 times, which greatly improves the communication efficiency.
